itemDescription: played first-class cricket for Somerset between 1895 and 1898 and for the MCC in 1901 and 1902

wikipedia_page.main: William Robert Rutherford Smith (23 April 1871 – 23 December 1946) played first-class cricket for Somerset between 1895 and 1898 and for the MCC in 1901 and 1902. He also played Minor Counties cricket for Wiltshire from 1899 to 1913 and for Worcestershire in minor matches before Worcestershire achieved first-class status in 1899. And he stood as an umpire in first-class cricket matches between 1919 and 1930. He was born at Batley, West Yorkshire and died at Ewell, Surrey.
